title: Drawing, "Earrings and Brooches", 1825–30
medium: Pen and ink, brush and sepia, gray watercolor on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Above are earrings, each consisting of a ring with three stones, the one at right with a blossom, and one hanging band with stems with blossoms or buds of diamonds and leaves of metal. The brooch at left in the shape of an escutcheon, with a frame of volutes and branches, in the center a blossom of diamonds. The escutcheons of the other are framed by rows of diamonds with three groups of diamonds on top. That of the central one containing a blossom and two stems converging to it; the one at right contains to stems with diamonds and other diamonds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Earrings and Brooches", 1825–30.
1825–30. Pen and ink, brush and sepia, gray watercolor on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-929.
